unnormalised: Urban planning in India needs a multi-pronged approach. The Smart Cities Mission aimed to improve infrastructure, but equitable access remains a challenge. As seen in "Wake Up Sid," Mumbai highlights the stark contrasts. We must prioritize affordable housing & sustainable transport, like efficient bus rapid transit systems, maybe even considering lessons from institutions like the Indian Institute of Urban Management. Focusing on pedestrian-friendly zones and reducing congestion are critical for better quality of life for all citizens. Rs. 500 crore allocated in the recent budget can be effectively channeled for development projects. For example, developing 20 km of dedicated cycle tracks in Bangalore is the need of the hour.
